sub_title: Securing freedom, one byte at a time.  Cyber Operations & Communications Systems Chief in the United States Air Force
summary: Experienced senior Information Technology (IT) manager and professional with a demonstrated history in cybersecurity, nuclear command, control, and communications (NC3), communications security (cryptography), information security, systems administration, physical security, project planning/implementation, financial management, comptroller, and resource management.  Elite operational leader, ranked in the top 2.5% within a 321,000-employee organization.  An expert in IT management and cybersecurity with 22 years of experience in guiding technical and non-technical personnel.  Subject matter expert who is consistently relied upon to conduct training, evaluations, and inspections of personnel, materials, and processes.  Served in vital positions and skilled in integrating team member strengths with organizational resources to ensure effective mission accomplishment.  Focused on organizational success, team building, mentorship, and human resource management.  Experienced with federal government work environment and security requirements.  Quick to adapt to various situations and maintain calm while under pressure.  I am interested in new opportunities in IT industry and willing to consider a location move.

school.name: Community College of the Air Force

education.degree_name: Associate of Arts and Sciences - AAS

school.name: Community College of the Air Force

education.degree_name: Associate of Arts and Sciences - AAS

profile_positions.description: Leads 17 personnel in 7 different functional specialties providing Command Control and Communications, COMSEC, Postal, Communications Maintenance, Information Assurance, Client Systems, & Cyber Support to 340 military personnel and their dependents.  Directed maintenance on 4 critical Command and Control Systems and Weapons Storage and Security Systems worth $52 million to ensure the security of $6 billion in Protection Level 1 (PL-1) assets.  Leads Two-Person Control and Positive Control Material programs and maintains 716 items in accordance with Chairman Joint Chiefs of Staff (CJCS), US European Command (USEUCOM), and US Air Forces in Europe (USAFE) directives.  Managed $1.1 million Custodian Authorization Custody Receipt Listing (CA/CRL) account, over 2,000 COMSEC items, and $213,000 Military Postal System assets.  Provides technical solutions for replacement/repair of computer information systems/cyber transport hardware & software.
profile_positions.title: Communications & Cyber Operations Chief

profile_positions.description: US Air Forces in Europe subject matter expert (SME) on cyber operations, communucations security (COMSEC/cryptography), two-person control, and positive control materials.  Conducted 18 staff assistance visits and inspections at various Protection Level 1 (PL-1) units.  Identified 261 discrepancies and provided training to other COMSEC account managers and their COMSEC responsible officers.  Enhanced combatant commander mission readiness.  Developed NATO Strike Evaluation cyber capabilities; bedded down 418 personnel and 8 aircraft from Italy, Netherlands, and the United States.  Resolved command and control limitations and communications issues for 6 partner nations.
profile_positions.title: Cyber Security Chief

profile_positions.description: Managed largest COMSEC account in the Air Force Materiel Command and fourth largest in the AF.  Supported 771 users on Eglin AFB and Duke Field.  Led 10 military personnel managing 69 COMSEC user accounts encompassing 6 major command, 5 wings, and 43 tenant units.  Oversaw and performed daily inventories to ensure efficient storage, handling, and security of over 20,000 COMSEC items.  Responsible for cryptographic material and equipment valued at over $10 million.  Performed self-inspection and unit compliance inspection preparations.
profile_positions.title: Communications Security Manager

profile_positions.description: Provided US Air Force in Europe, Air Mobility Command, and Air Force Space Command forces with planning and implementation of critical Command, Control, Communications, and Computer (C4) systems requirements.  Managed the Communications Flight’s $240,000 annual budget. Verified all commercial telecommunication invoices coordinated payment and oversaw telephone reimbursements. Developed technical solutions for new C4 requirements. Determined and planned the future target C4 systems architecture for Moron AB. Coordinated engineering and requirements processing for Moron's $3.5 million LAN and $2.3 million in maintenance equipment.  Assisted in contract development for all C4 projects and verifies the acceptability of service. Organized communications-computer systems installation (CSIR) records.  Administered the Project Workflow Requirement Resource (PWRR) system.
profile_positions.title: Plans and Programs Manager - Command, Control, Communications, & Computers (C4)

profile_positions.description: Provided top quality service to 500 systems over two critical networks. Successfully managed the Moron AB computer network technical refresh, configured 5 servers valued at $30,000.   Ensured project was 50% ahead of schedule with minimal service interruptions.  Managed $3.5 million USAFE-funded Moron AB Voice over IP installation.  Planned Standard Procurement System server upgrades; protected contracting data valued at $200 million.  Kept critical upgrade schedule, minimal downtime and increased functionality enable 496 ABS Contracting Flight to complete the end-of-year (fiscal) closeout
profile_positions.title: Network Systems Section Supervisor

profile_positions.description: Provided support to Headquarters Seventh Air Force, 51st Fighter Wing, 12 tenant organizations, and five geographically separated units serviced by Osan Air Base. Administered classified and unclassified network core services including network monitoring, electronic mail, Defense Message System (DMS), file, secure remote access, web, and storage area network servers. Coordinated with PACAF Network Operations and Security Center (NOSC) to ensure system patches and security updates are installed. Configured and updated servers and client systems with latest virus protection software.  Scheduled, verified, and restored data files and server configurations to ensure integrity and availability. Coordinated with Network Control Center work centers to resolve network outages and customer issues.
profile_positions.title: Configuration Management Technician

profile_positions.description: Implemented network security and Information Assurance programs for 5,500 desktop computer systems worth over $5.5 million assigned to 14th Air Force, 30th Space Wing, and 27 associate units.  Provided guidance and educated 5,200 users on communications, computer and network security issues.  Investigated and reported network security incidents to higher authorities.  Performed base-wide on-line system vulnerability scans and analyzed audit logs for illegal or unauthorized activity.  Created and applied corrective security procedures.  Tracked base-wide compliance with security patches and produced 48 major command-level reports monthly.
profile_positions.title: Computer Network Defense Technician

profile_positions.description: Provided customer assistance and accounting support to 13 Air Force bases, 25 Air National Guard units, 2 Air Reserve bases, and 1 Department of Defense Agency serviced by the Omaha Operating Location (OPLOC).  Branch focal point for all Aviation Fuel and Hazardous Waste Interfund Billings and processed intergovernmental and adjustment transactions affecting Merged Accountability and Fund Reporting (MAFR) into the General Accounting and Finance System (GAFS).  Processed over 1,800 transactions totaling $230 million in disbursements and $55 million in reimbursements with an accuracy rate of 99 percent.  Skillfully obligated over $200 million with remarkable accuracy and enabled continued flying mission readiness at 13 bases.  Certified the validity of over $17 million in outstanding obligations and saved $1.6 million in the elimination of uncollected payments.
profile_positions.title: Financial Controller
